name: Hex-grid: Corn, Fox, Chicken puzzle
description:
A prototype hex-grid adaptation of the fox / chicken / corn puzzle, made in 3 days as a technical demonstration.

Things to keep in mind when playing:

- The player can move on the same tiles as the fox, chicken, and corn.
- The fox cannot eat the chicken whilst you hold it.
- The chicken cannot eat the corn whilst you hold it.
- You can pick up and put down as many times as you want in your turn
- You cannot put down the fox, chicken, or corn in the river tiles.

The original puzzle, as outlined here:

"A man has to get a fox, a chicken, and a sack of corn across a river.
He has a rowboat, and it can only carry him and one other thing.
If the fox and the chicken are left together, the fox will eat the chicken.
If the chicken and the corn are left together, the chicken will eat the corn.
How does the man do it?"

Enjoy!
